option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"D:/Car Rental System Project/car_rental_system":"{\"/application/rental_management.py\":\"`RentalManagement`: Handles rental management logic for admin operations.\\n\\n`get_pending_rentals`: Retrieves all pending rental requests.\\n\\n`update_rental_status`: Updates the status of a rental request.\\n\\n`calculate_late_fee`: Calculates the late fee for a rental based on the return date.\\n\\n`process_return`: Processes the return of a rental and calculates the late fee if applicable.\\n\\nThis file contains a `RentalManagement` class that provides methods for managing rental operations, such as retrieving pending rentals, updating rental status, calculating late fees, and processing rental returns.\",\"/data_models/booking.py\":\"`Booking`: Represents a booking in the car rental system.\\n\\n`__init__`: Initializes the Booking object with the provided parameters.\\n\\n`__repr__`: Provides a string representation of the Booking object for debugging purposes.\\n\\n`calculate_total_cost`: Calculates the total cost of the booking based on rental duration, rental fee, and additional charges.\\n\\n`booking_duration`: Calculates the booking duration in days.\\n\\n`is_pending`: Checks if the booking is pending approval.\\n\\n`is_confirmed`: Checks if the booking is confirmed.\\n\\n`is_cancelled`: Checks if the booking is cancelled.\\n\\n`to_dict`: Converts the Booking object to a dictionary.\\n\\n`from_dict`: Creates a Booking object from a dictionary.\\n\\n`_parse_date`: Parses a date string into a datetime object.\",\"/data_models/car.py\":\"`Car`: A class that represents a car with various attributes such as car ID, make, model, year, mileage, availability, and rental period.\\n\\n`__init__`: Initializes the Car object with the provided parameters.\\n\\n`__repr__`: Provides a string representation of the Car object for debugging purposes.\\n\\n`is_available`: Checks if the car is currently available for rental.\\n\\n`to_dict`: Converts the Car object to a dictionary.\\n\\n`from_dict`: Creates a Car object from a dictionary.\",\"/data_models/user.py\":\"`User`: A class that represents a user with various attributes such as user ID, username, password hash, role, and other personal information.\\n\\n`__init__`: Initializes a `User` object with the provided parameters.\\n\\n`__repr__`: Returns a string representation of the `User` object.\\n\\n`is_admin`: Checks if the user has the \\u0027admin\\u0027 role.\\n\\n`is_customer`: Checks if the user has the \\u0027customer\\u0027 role.\\n\\n`validate_password`: Verifies the input password against the stored password hash.\\n\\n`to_dict`: Converts the `User` object to a dictionary.\\n\\n`from_dict`: Creates a `User` object from a dictionary of user data.\",\"/database/db_connection.py\":\"This file defines a `DatabaseConnection` class and several methods for managing a MySQL database connection.\\n\\n`DatabaseConnection`: A class that provides a connection to a MySQL database using environment variables for configuration.\\n\\n`__init__`: Loads the database configuration from the `.env` file.\\n`connect`: Establishes a connection to the database.\\n`cursor`: Returns a cursor object for executing queries.\\n`commit`: Commits any changes to the database.\\n`close`: Closes the database connection.\\n`reconnect`: Re-establishes the database connection in case of disconnection.\\n`ping`: Pings the server to check if the connection is alive.\\n`__enter__`: Enters the context and returns the connection object.\\n`__exit__`: Exits the context and closes the connection.\\n`query`: Executes a query and reconnects if the connection is lost.\",\"/application/main.py\":\"This file is a Python script that implements a car rental system. It includes various functions and classes to manage user registration, login, car management, rental booking, and rental management. Here\\u0027s a summary of the classes and functions in the file:\\n\\n`main()`: The main function that initializes the application and handles the main menu.\\n\\n`register_menu(user_management)`: Displays the registration menu and handles the registration process for customers and admins.\\n\\n`register_customer(user_management)`: Registers a new customer by collecting the necessary information.\\n\\n`register_admin(user_management)`: Registers a new admin by collecting the necessary information and verifying the admin access code.\\n\\n`login_menu(user_management)`: Displays the login menu and handles the login process, including the option to reset the password.\\n\\n`handle_login(user_management)`: Handles the login process by verifying the username and password.\\n\\n`handle_forgot_password(user_management)`: Handles the password reset process by generating a reset token and updating the password.\\n\\n`admin_menu(car_management, rental_management)`: Displays the admin menu and handles the various administrative tasks, such as adding, updating, and deleting cars, approving and rejecting rental requests, and generating reports.\\n\\n`add_car(car_management)`: Adds a new car to the system.\\n\\n`update_car(car_management)`: Updates the details of an existing car.\\n\\n`delete_car(car_management)`: Deletes a car from the system.\\n\\n`view_all_cars(car_management)`: Displays a list of all the cars in the system.\\n\\n`approve_rental(rental_management)`: Approves a rental request.\\n\\n`reject_rental(rental_management)`: Rejects a rental request.\\n\\n`generate_reports(rental_management)`: Generates rental reports.\\n\\n`customer_menu(rental_booking, user_id)`: Displays the customer menu and handles the various customer-related tasks, such as viewing available cars, booking a car, viewing rental history, and canceling a booking.\\n\\n`view_available_cars(rental_booking)`: Displays a list of available cars.\\n\\n`book_car(rental_booking, user_id)`: Handles the car booking process.\\n\\n`view_rental_history(rental_booking, user_id)`: Displays the rental history for a specific user.\\n\\n`cancel_booking(rental_booking, user_id)`: Cancels a booking for a specific user.\",\"/application/config.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines a dictionary `DatabaseConfig` that holds the configuration settings for a MySQL database. The configuration settings include the host, user, password, database name, and port. This configuration can be used to connect to the database in a Python application.\",\"/database/queries.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it defines various SQL queries for a car rental management system. The queries cover the following functionalities:\\n\\n1. User Management:\\n - `create_user`: Inserts a new user into the `user_management` table.\\n - `get_user_by_username`: Retrieves a user\\u0027s ID, password hash, and role based on the username.\\n - `update_user_password`: Updates a user\\u0027s password hash based on the user ID.\\n - `select_user_by_email`: Retrieves a user\\u0027s ID and first name based on the email.\\n\\n2. Car Management:\\n - `add_car`: Inserts a new car into the `cars` table.\\n - `select_available_cars`: Retrieves all available cars from the `cars` table.\\n - `select_car_by_id`: Retrieves a car\\u0027s details based on the car ID.\\n - `update_car`: Updates a car\\u0027s details in the `cars` table.\\n - `delete_car`: Deletes a car from the `cars` table based on the car ID.\\n\\n3. Rental Booking:\\n - `create_rental`: Inserts a new rental booking into the `rentals` table.\\n - `select_rentals_by_user`: Retrieves all rental bookings for a specific user.\\n - `select_rental_by_status`: Retrieves all rental bookings with a specific status.\\n - `select_rental_by_id`: Retrieves a rental booking\\u0027s details based on the rental ID.\\n - `update_rental_status`: Updates the status of a rental booking.\\n\\n4. Rental Management (Admin Operations):\\n - `get_pending_rentals`: Retrieves all pending rental bookings.\\n - `approve_rental`: Updates the status of a rental booking to \\\"Approved\\\".\\n - `reject_rental`: Updates the status of a rental booking to \\\"Rejected\\\".\\n - `update_rental_cost`: Updates the total cost of a rental booking.\",\"/application/user_management.py\":\"This file contains a `UserManagement` class and several functions related to user management, such as user registration, login, password reset, and token generation.\\n\\n`UserManagement`: Manages user-related operations such as registration, login, and password reset.\\n\\n`generate_reset_code()`: Generates a random 8-character alphanumeric token for password reset.\\n`set_reset_code(email)`: Generates and saves a reset token for the user.\\n`validate_reset_code(email, code)`: Checks if the reset token is valid for the user.\\n`update_password(email, new_password)`: Updates the user\\u0027s password.\\n`register_user(...)`: Registers a new user with detailed profile information.\\n`login_user(username, password)`: Logs in a user by validating credentials.\\n`reset_password(email)`: Resets the user\\u0027s password without sending a notification.\",\"/data_models/rental.py\":\"`Rental`: A class that represents a rental transaction, including details such as rental ID, user ID, car ID, start and end dates, total cost, status, expected and actual return dates, and base fee.\\n\\n`rental_duration`: Calculates the rental duration in days.\\n`approve`: Approves the rental request if it is in the \\\"Pending\\\" status.\\n`reject`: Rejects the rental request if it is in the \\\"Pending\\\" status.\\n`is_pending`: Checks if the rental is in the \\\"Pending\\\" status.\\n`is_approved`: Checks if the rental is in the \\\"Approved\\\" status.\\n`is_rejected`: Checks if the rental is in the \\\"Rejected\\\" status.\\n`to_dict`: Converts the Rental object to a dictionary.\\n`from_dict`: Creates a Rental object from a dictionary.\\n`_parse_date`: Parses a date string into a datetime object.\\n`calculate_late_fee`: Calculates the late fee based on the actual return date and expected return date.\\n`calculate_total_fee`: Calculates the total fee (base fee + late fee).\",\"/application/car_management.py\":\"`CarManagement`: Manages car-related operations such as adding, updating, and retrieving cars.\\n\\n`__init__`: Initializes the `CarManager` with a database connection.\\n\\n`add_car`: Adds a new car to the system.\\n\\n`get_available_cars`: Retrieves all available cars from the system.\\n\\n`update_car`: Updates the details of a car.\\n\\n`delete_car`: Deletes a car from the system.\",\"/application/rental_booking.py\":\"`RentalBooking`: Handles the logic for booking car rentals for customers.\\n\\n`book_car`: Books a car for a specific user and rental period.\\n`get_available_cars`: Retrieves all available cars for booking.\\n`calculate_rental_fees`: Calculates the total rental cost based on the daily rate, start date, end date, and any additional charges.\\n\\nThis file contains a class `RentalBooking` that provides functionality for booking car rentals, retrieving available cars, and calculating rental fees. The class interacts with a database to perform these operations.\"}"}
